column2: When I watch the deals being made, when I watch what's happening with some horrible things like Obamacare, where your health insurance and health care is going up by numbers that are astronomical, 68 percent, 59 percent, 71 percent, when I look at the Iran deal and how bad a deal it is for us, it's a onesided transaction where we're giving back $150 billion to a terrorist state, really, the number one terror state, we've made them a strong country from really a very weak country just three years ago.
column4: Because of Obamacare "peoples premiums ...are going up 35, 45, 55 percent."

column2: Last year, we had almost $800 billion trade deficit.
column4: Our trade deficit in goods reached nearly  $800 billion last year alone.

column2: We had an $800 billion deficit.
column4: Our trade deficit in goods reached nearly  $800 billion last year alone.

column2: We have seen him insult women.
column4: Some of the things that (Megyn Kelly) said, I didnt say.

column2: But it's not only women, and it's not only this video that raises questions about his fitness to be our president, because he has also targeted immigrants, African Americans, Latinos, people with disabilities, POWs, Muslims, and so many others.

column2: I heard them when they were running for the Senate in New York, where Hillary was going to bring back jobs to upstate New York and she failed.
column4: Says Hillary Clinton "promised, running for the Senate years ago, 200,000 jobs for upstate New York. ... Not only didn't they come, but they lost so many jobs."

column2: Her client she represented got him off, and she's seen laughing on two separate occasions, laughing at the girl who was raped.
column4: Says after Hillary Clinton helped a man accused of raping a 12yearold, "she's seen laughing on two separate occasions, laughing at the girl who was raped."

column2: Well, you owe the president an apology, because as you know very well, your campaign, Sidney Blumenthal  he's another real winner that you have  and he's the one that got this started, along with your campaign manager, and they were on television just two weeks ago, she was, saying exactly that.
column4: Hillary Clinton and her campaign of 2008 startedthe birther controversy.

column2: There has never been anything like this, where emails  and you get a subpoena, you get a subpoena, and after getting the subpoena, you delete 33,000 emails, and then you acid wash them or bleach them, as you would say, very expensive process.
column4: You (Hillary Clinton) get a subpoena, and after getting the subpoena you delete 33,000 emails.

column2: Right now, we are at 90 percent health insurance coverage.
column4: Right now we are at 90 percent health insurance covered. That's the highest we've ever been in our country.

column4: Right now we are at 90 percent health insurance covered. That's the highest we've ever been in our country.

column2: And indeed, you can look at the propaganda on a lot of the terrorists sites, and what Donald Trump says about Muslims is used to recruit fighters, because they want to create a war between us.

column2: I was against  I was against the war in Iraq.

column2: When I was secretary of state, I went around the world advocating for our country, but also advocating for women's rights, to make sure that women had a decent chance to have a better life and negotiated a treaty with Russia to lower nuclear weapons.
column4: Says New START, passed while Clinton was secretary of state, is a "treaty cutting Russias nuclear arms."

column2: Well, what Russia did with Assad and, by the way, with Iran, who you made very powerful with the dumbest deal perhaps I've ever seen in the history of dealmaking, the Iran deal, with the $150 billion, with the $1.7 billion in cash, which is enough to fill up this room.
column4: Under the Iran nuclear deal, "we give them $150 billion, we get nothing."
